item.description:
Story Slam, Season IV in Fall 2012! Sold out! Check at massmouth.com and stories@massmouth.com for updates.

Theme: semi final

Winners of story slam season IV will get together to compete for a spot in the BIG MOUTH OFF.

Slam themes included: Schooled, Sixth Sense, Politics, Kin, Pets, Betrayal

Admission: $15 in advnace, $20 at the door

http://massmouthjp-semi.eventbrite.com

What is a Story Slam? A story slam is a contest of stories by known and undiscovered talent. Themes are posted on our events pages (www.massmouth.com) and story slammers sign up on the night to tell a 5-minute short story on the evening's theme. Ten names will be drawn at random from a box. A team of 5 volunteer judges - interested amateurs, storytellers, theater people and members of the audience who love stories - evaluate how well each story is told, how well it is constructed, how well the story explores, connects and/or reveals some truth about the theme and, how well it honors the time limit. The 2 highest-scoring tellers are awarded prizes and an opportunity to perform at the "BigMouthOff" at the at the end of the slam season (Sept  - April).

For more info, visit: http://massmouth.ning.com/forum/topics/story-slam-rules-pr-what-is

 

Tickets in advance are recommended.

Buy your tickets here:
http://massmouth.eventbrite.com


Regulary recognized as Boston's best bar and restaurant, Doyle's offers and unmatched mix of good food, good talk and good people.


Doyle's is host to one of New England's largest selections of draft beer.  The mahogany bar dates back over 125 years to 1882.


Doyle's is located in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston, accessible by the Orange line and close to the Sam Adams Brewery!
Nearest transit: Green Street (Orange Line)

group.name: Greater Boston and MA Storytelling Meetup Group

item.name: Season IV: Doyle's Cafe -- SEMI FINAL
